block.p: Kerry Ellen Flynn, the daughter of Patricia D. Flynn and Cormack Flynn of Ramsey, N.J., was married yesterday in Rockleigh, N.J., to Christopher John Andrew, a son of Evelyn Andrew and John Andrew of Kearny, N.J. Jason King, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated at the Rockleigh Country Club.
The bride, who graduated cum laude from Mary Washington College in Fredericksburg, Va., and the bridegroom, a Rutgers graduate, met on the Newark campus of Rutgers, where each received a law degree.
The couple were married Saturday at the Rockleigh Country Club.

Kerry Ellen Flynn, the daughter of Patricia D. Flynn and Cormack Flynn of Ramsey, N.J., was married yesterday in Rockleigh, N.J., to Christopher John Andrew, a son of Evelyn Andrew and John Andrew of Kearny, N.J. Jason King, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated at the Rockleigh Country Club.
The bride, who graduated cum laude from Mary Washington College in Fredericksburg, Va., and the bridegroom, a Rutgers graduate, met on the Newark campus of Rutgers, where each received a law degree.

Ms. Flynn, 29, is keeping her name. She is a compliance officer in the securities division of Goldman Sachs in New York. She also has an M.B.A. from Rutgers. Her father, who is retired, worked in Clifton, N.J., as a flavor chemist for Givaudan-Roure, a Swiss fragrance and flavors maker. Her mother, also retired, was the personnel director at the Fountain, a day spa in Ramsey.

Mr. Andrew, 33, is a corporate associate specializing in mergers and acquisitions at Debevoise & Plimpton, the New York law firm. His mother, who is retired, taught kindergarten at Garfield Elementary School in Kearny. His father, also retired, was a bricklayer who worked for the Bricklayers and Allied Craftsmen Local 4, in New Jersey.
